analysis.functional_summary: The MAPGEN JCL script is designed to assemble BMS maps for a legacy system. It processes map definitions, assembles them using an assembler program, and links the resulting object code into a load library.
data_flow: Step 1: Copy map source from &CBSAHLQ..BMS(&MEMBER) to temporary dataset
Step 2: Assemble map using specified assembler program
Step 3: Link assembled map into load library &CBSAHLQ..LOADLIB(&MEMBER)
state_changes: Modification of load library with new map object code
side_effects: File I/O operations on temporary datasets
interface_points: File system interfaces for dataset access
algorithms: Use of IEBGENER for dataset copying
Assembly of map source using specified assembler
Linking of object code using IEWL
performance_characteristics: Dependent on assembler and linker performance
I/O operations on datasets may affect performance
error_handling: Relies on system-level error handling for JCL execution
No explicit error logging within the JCL script
modernization_notes: Consider refactoring to use modern build tools
Potential to convert JCL to a more modern scripting language
Evaluate use of modern CI/CD pipelines for map assembly
analysis.analysis_notes: The JCL script is straightforward but relies heavily on legacy assembler and linker programs. Modernization could involve replacing these with more contemporary tools and processes.
